addressleaf.section:
To
e right Worshipfull my verie loving frend M
r
Thomas Bodley esquie
r
Counsello
r
for
[he]
r Ma
tie
in
e Countie of state in
e Lowe Contries.

From S
r
Fraunc
Walsingham the 4 of Julye

page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 4 July To M
r
Bodly
M
r
Thomas Bodley
S
r
For that the proceedings of our Fleete in
Portingall
may bee there diversely and untruly reported as many times
yt falleth out, I have sent you hereinclosed an extract
of
S
r
John Norreis
&
S
r
Francis Drakes
owne l
re
s to
e
end you may understand the truth thereof, w
ch
thoughe
yt hath not fallen out so profitably for our partie
as was expected by reason
King Don Anthonio
fayled of
his support of Portingals, yet hath the enterprise been
attempted w
th
great hono
r
as by the said extract
you shall more particulerly perceyve.
The
States
have here been verie earnest, for that the
horse and foote employed in this Portingall service,
are not returned as was apointed by the first of June,
to bee supplied of others in their places to
e like nomber,
and to
t
effect will happely deale with you there:
I have thought good therfore to lett you understand what
answeare they have here receaved by mee, to thend you
might be acquainted therew
th
all and give them
e like ther
yf you bee pressed therunto. Which is this: that their
not returne growing as yt doth, from the said States, in
that they kept not promise w
th
S
r
John Norris whereby
the voyage at
e first was greatly hindered, and therby
in the execution also not accompanied w
th
that successe
that otherwise might have been expected yf
e
King of
Spaine
had been taken unprovided as no doubt he had
been, there is no reason they should demaund newe forces
in place of those other, especially the other being nowe
employed to impeach
e said Kings treasures at
e Islands
which wilbe no lesse profitable to
e said States then
fol.6v
unto her
Ma
tie
for that
e said King shall thereby bee
disabled (yf yt please God to blesse them w
th
good
successe) to mainteyne the Warres amongest them
there as nowe he doth.
And thus I c
o
mende you
to God. From
e Court at Nonsuch the fourth
of July
1589.
Yo
r
assured loving frend. Francis Walsyngham
